image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Woman compared to Hawk Tuah girl for ice-cream video. Then this happened
item.description: TikTok now announced that a new Hawk Tuah girl has come and is waiting to take over the Internet. The woman was seen having ice cream with her friend at a live match. The video went viral from the live telecast of the match by a channel. The woman slammed the trend and hit out at the channel for sexualizing her video. She said she was getting compared to the Hawk Tuah girl - implying no offence to her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Maldives minister who performed 'black magic' on President Muizzu?
item.description: ​Fathimath Shammaz Ali Saleem, the environment minister of Maldives, was arrested for allegedly performing black magic on President Mohamed Muizzu. She was also suspended from her post following her arrest. Police have not officially confirmed the 'black magic' part but they said they were investigating a case involving Shamnaz and two other individuals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US supreme court ruling allows abortions in Idaho for medical emergencies
item.description: ​​The 6-3 decision, with three conservative justices dissenting, temporarily reinstated a lower court's ruling that Idaho's near-total abortion ban, which is backed by Republicans, must give way to the Emergency Medical Treatment and Labor Act (EMTALA) of 1986 when the two laws are in conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bill Gates' daughter Jennifer announces second pregnancy
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Polling expert Nate Silver predicts high chances for Donald Trump win in 2024 presidential polls
item.description: Nate Silver's forecast favors Trump for the 2024 election, urging strategic decisions for Biden. Silver's accuracy history prompts scrutiny on Democratic strategies and potential convention changes for Biden's campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Human remains found near missing Texas student’s apartment
item.description: Harris, a student at Texas A&M University – Corpus Christi, disappeared on March 4 while walking near his apartment complex in the early morning hours.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Why Muslim dish names': Indian man recounts experience in Vienna restaurant
item.description: An Indian man posted a long thread on X recounting his experience at an Indian restaurant in Vienna where a group of Indians asked the owner why there were Mughal paintings and why they had 'Muslim dish' names. As the post went viral, a user wrote: "So, u r saying German and others should love it if I open a "German restaurant" and put up the large paintings of Hitler there?"
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Has Donald Trump support increased in Black, Hispanic voters after his mugshot?
item.description: "Since [the mugshot] happened, the support among the Black community and the Hispanic community has skyrocketed," Trump said. "It has been amazing, really been amazing."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why US Air Force fired top program manager for next-gen ‘Sentinel’ missiles
item.description: The US Air Force has removed Colonel Charles Clegg, the official in charge of the development of the next-generation ‘Sentinel’ intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM). This missile is set to replace the aging Minuteman III, a crucial component of the United States' nuclear triad, originally deployed in the 1970s.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: CDC data shows Covid-19 cases rising in majority of US states
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Michelle Obama 'not keen' to campaign for Biden. This is why
item.description: ​Former first lay Michelle Obama is not very keen to publicly campaign for President Joe Biden's re-election because Kathleen Buhle, Hunter Biden's former wife, is Michelle's friend, reports claimed. Axios reported that Michelle was not happy how the Bidens treated her friend. Hunter Biden who is under fire for the gun case, split from Kathleen in 2017. In his memoir, he documented his ex-wife's friendship with Michelle -- they used to work out together at the gym and often had evening cocktails at the White House -- at both formal and informal events.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Seattle struggles with increasing drug use and prostitution
item.description: Seattle is grappling with a severe crisis as parts of the city have turned into what some residents are calling a "zombieland" due to rampant drug use and prostitution. The situation has significantly deteriorated, raising concerns among locals and officials alike.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China is hiring Western aviators for Taiwan conflict
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is reportedly hiring Western military aviators to enhance its combat readiness in anticipation of a potential conflict with Taiwan. This revelation comes from a Taiwanese military expert who has raised alarms about the implications of such hires for regional security.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Native American ceremony celebrates rare white buffalo birth in Yellowstone
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Americans didn't land on the Moon': How China is fuelling misinformation war against US
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Hawk Tuah girl set for Hollywood debut? Here's what we know so far
item.description: A lot has happened after Hawk Tuah took over the Internet on June 11. A Tennessee-based company, the official platform for Hawk Tuah merchandise, has sold at least $65,000 worth of merchandise. Hailey Welch, the Hawk Tuah girl is in touch with lawyers to get a trademark on her phrase. Rumors of Welch debuting in Hollywood are also doing the rounds. Meanwhile, Brandon Gaudin said 'Hawk Tuah' during match commentary.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry deliberately destroyed phone hacking evidence: Report
item.description: ​Prince Harry was awarded 140,600 pounds last year after the London high court ruled that he had been the victim of "modest" phone hacking and other unlawful information gathering by journalists of British newspapers. Now it has been claimed that the Duke of Sussex deliberately destroyed potential evidence relating to the high court hacking claim, The Telegraph reported. The new claims surfaced ahead of a hearing on the case on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ashley's 'LGBCT...' moment viral ahead of tonight's massive Biden vs Trump
item.description: Ahead of tonight's first presidential face-off between Joe Biden and Donald Trump, the video of Biden's daughter Ashley Biden finding it hard to say 'LGBTQ' went viral with social media users claiming that the apple doesn't fall far from the tree and that the family needs help -- given the recent gaffe videos of President Joe Biden which the White House dismissed. In the viral video, Ashley was attempting to say 'LGBTQ' but fumbled for a moment as she said 'LGBCT..' LGBTQ is widely known acronym for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Scientists warn of 'most dangerous' mpox strain causing miscarriages, child deaths
item.description: Researchers warn of a new, deadly strain of mpox in the Democratic Republic of Congo, causing miscarriages and child fatalities. Known as clade Ib, it spreads via sexual and non-sexual contact, posing a significant health threat. Originating in Kamituga, South Kivu, it has led to over 1,000 cases with high mortality rates. Concerns mount over its potential spread to neighbouring countries, emphasizing the need for preparedness and vaccine efficacy evaluation amid fears of a wider epidemic.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
